headline: Report: Oz Looks to Exit Senate Race, Return to Television
author: Blarp Blog
sentences: Reports that Oz is planning his return to television come just one week after recent polls show businessman David McCormick is the clear frontrunner in Pennsylvania’s Republican U.S. Senate primary.

A source told Radar Online that Oz “knows his campaign is on life support.”
The source said:
He is only 61-years-old and isn’t ready to retire if he doesn’t go to Washington DC.
Oz, the former host of The Dr. Oz Show, announced his candidacy last November, one week after former President Donald Trump’s pick, Sean Parnell, suspended his campaign.
Celebrity doctor Mehmet Oz is already in talks to return to television if his candidacy for U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania is unsuccessful, according to a recent report.
There is no way he is going to return to talk about blood pressure and bowel moments when he could be talking about keeping America great again.
Behind McCormick is Oz, who trails McCormick by nine points, earning just 15 percent support from Republican primary voters.
Like any good doctor, he is already looking for alternatives to keep his career alive if he doesn’t win.
Fortunately for him, his appearances on Fox News and Newsmax have impressed the bosses.
Which is why there has already been talk about him becoming a primetime opinion host.
Oz is running to replace retiring Republican Senator Pat Toomey (R-PA) in Congress.
Who knows, maybe he will be more powerful on primetime than sitting in the Senate.
McCormick has the most support among Republican primary voters, at 24 percent.
Pennsylvania’s Republican Senate primary will happen on May 17.
There is no doubt that he is a very gifted communicator on TV.
No one wants to admit defeat, but he isn’t a stupid man.

An insider added:
We have not heard the last of Dr. Oz.
What is for sure is now politics is in his blood.
He knows his campaign is on life support.
